model.name: Down to Zero II
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    q_temp <- getLine
    let q = read q_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the minimum number of moves to reduce N to zero using the constraints given.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          Q_t (read-line) 
          Q (Integer/parseInt Q_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 Q]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              N_t (read-line) 
              N (Integer/parseInt N_t) 
            ]
          )

        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [Q]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d")
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
Q = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < Q do
    N = io.read("*number", "*l")
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
